titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Owen Dodson Collection
titlestmt.author: Drew Adan and Lisa Conathan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. For further information, see notes at the level of each acquisition.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Owen Dodson Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Owen Dodson Collection. Yale Collection of American Literature. Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call numbers: Uncat JWJ MS 54, Uncat JWJ MS 57, JWJ MSS Dodson

Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization, in 1996, with further processing carried out in 2013. The list of Acquisitions before 1994 was produced from previously existing catalog cards, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. This is a preliminary listing of materials. The typescript copy of the Divine Comedy (Box 3, folder 51b) was added in May, 1999. The May 1994 and June 1995 Acquisitions were added to the collection contents in 2013. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Owen Dodson (1914-1983)
bioghist.p: Owen Vincent Dodson, American playwright, was born in Brooklyn, New York in 1914. He received a B.A. from Bates College in 1936 and a M.F.A. in playwriting from the Yale School of Drama in 1939. He was on the faculty of Howard University's Drama Department from 1947 to 1969. He also briefly worked for Spelman College, Atlanta University, and Hampton Institute. Although best known for his playwriting, Dodson also published two novels and several volumes of poetry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Owen Dodson Collection consists of correspondence, writings, diaries, photographs, artwork, and posters that document the life and work of American playwright and poet Owen Dodson. The bulk of the material was created and accumulated by Owen Dodson in the course of his activities as an author and theater director, though portions of the collection were acquired from other sources.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two groupings: Acquisitions before 1994; May 1994 and June 1995 Acquisitions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Correspondence, 1937-1945. II. Writings, 1936-1951. III. Personal Papers, 1942. IV. Drawings, undated.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Material in this grouping was chiefly acquired by gift from Owen Dodson, 1939-1945, and dates unknown.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into seven series: I. Correspondence, 1896-1981. II. Writings, 1941-1982. III. Diaries, 1938-1982. IV. Photographs, 1951-1977. V. Posters, 1947-1977. VI. Drawings, 1947-1964. VII. Papers Relating to the Estate of Edith Dodson, 1963-1983.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from McBlain Books on the James Weldon Johnson Memorial Collection of Negro Arts & Letters Fund, 1994-1995.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Owen Dodson Correspondence, and Family Correspondence.
